p: Finally, to assess whether the depletion of CCR2 + cells impacts the control of other alphavirus infections, we infected DT-treated CCR2-DTR + mice and their WT littermates with CHIKV. At 5 dpi, CHIKV-infected CCR2-DTR mice displayed impaired weight gain ( Fig 5A) and increased viral burdens in the ankle (3-fold; P < 0.05) ( Fig 5B) and the serum ( P < 0.01) ( Fig 5C) compared with CHIKV-infected WT mice, suggesting that Ly6C hi inflammatory monocytes also contribute to the control of acute CHIKV infection.
